title: Nacho Cheese Sauce with Jalapeno Recipe
description: Pickled jalapenos and pickled jalapeno juice are combined with American cheese to make an ooey-gooey nacho cheese sauce with a kick.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Nacho Cheese Sauce with Jalapeno 4.2 (18) 15 Reviews 4 Photos Here's a simple jalapeno cheese sauce for chip dipping or for over tacos or anything needing a cheesy sauce with a kick. Submitted by duboo Updated on September 21, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 23 mins Total Time: 28 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 tablespoons butter ¼ cup minced onion 1 clove garlic, minced 3 pickled jalapeno pepper slices, minced 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 1 cup milk ¼ (1 pound) loaf processed cheese food (such as Velveeta®) ¼ teaspoon pickled jalapeno pepper juice Directions Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion, garlic, and jalapeno; cook and stir until onion turns translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir flour into onion mixture until vegetables are evenly coated. Pour in milk; cook and stir until mixture thickens slightly, 3 to 4 minutes. Add processed cheese food, stirring constantly, until melted and smooth, about 15 minutes more. Stir in pickled jalapeno juice. I Made It Print 44 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 111 Calories 9g Fat 5g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 111 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 11% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 25mg 8% Sodium 246mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 3g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 6mg 6% Calcium 119mg 9% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 107mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Nacho Cheese Sauce with Jalapeno 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 05/02/2018 Let me start out by saying I'm not a big fan of Velveeta Cheese but this one worked. Addictive cheese sauce. 03 of 04 Photo by  Cat McElroy 12/15/2016 04 of 04 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 03/16/2016 Made as written except that I added a couple more jalapeno's for more heat. Turns out I should have stuck to just three because my addition made it a little too spicy. Lesson learned. This melted down nicely for me and I really liked the addition of onions. This sauce could be used for many different things and I bet it would be equally good with the blanco Velveeta. Definitely a keeper! 1 You’ll Also Love Not'yo Ordinary Nacho Cheese Sauce 19 Ratings Real Nacho Cheese Sauce 39 Ratings Cilantro Jalapeno Pesto with Lime 54 Ratings Ex-Girlfriend's Mom's Salsa Fresca (Pico de Gallo) 229 Ratings Cilantro-Chili Pepper Sauce 9 Ratings Christopholofigus' Infamous Jalapeño Relish 34 Ratings Jalapeno Hot Sauce 139 Ratings Quesadilla Sauce 16 Ratings Cilantro Serrano Cream Sauce 99 Ratings Chicken Mole with Four Chiles 22 Ratings Fresh Tomato Chili Sauce 35 Ratings Wasabi - Jalapeno Sauce 7 Ratings Raspberry Chipotle Sauce 41 Ratings Deliciosa Salsa Verde 46 Ratings JD's Chile Paste Colombian Ají 25 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: duboo
instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion, garlic, and jalapeno; cook and stir until onion turns translucent, about 5 minutes.;Stir flour into onion mixture until vegetables are evenly coated. Pour in milk; cook and stir until mixture thickens slightly, 3 to 4 minutes. Add processed cheese food, stirring constantly, until melted and smooth, about 15 minutes more. Stir in pickled jalapeno juice.
